messages: d275159e7b2073ebc4013dd29b1bd8f2 (16:13): Hi there. Is it a good idea to use Grub to boot NetBSD?
fdb81c28abf19eb8a5bd9cf736796c16 (16:15): Hi idealm. :P Yes it's an OK idea. :P
fdb81c28abf19eb8a5bd9cf736796c16 (16:15): Don't see a point to it if you're not dualbooting though.
fdb81c28abf19eb8a5bd9cf736796c16 (16:15): Sadly, I don't know how the rest goes. :P
bb7b9d8ae0b37a460dba8dbbc9359251 (16:17): i use lilo to boot netbsd
bb7b9d8ae0b37a460dba8dbbc9359251 (16:17): i have an OS for every mood
d275159e7b2073ebc4013dd29b1bd8f2 (16:22): Hi pseudo__, I do want to dualboot NetBSD and Debian Linux.
f87604c621866f33443baff2929a0373 (16:24): Slackware would be OK, but Debian! :|
d275159e7b2073ebc4013dd29b1bd8f2 (16:57): It seems NetBSD doesn't support ReiserFS.
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (16:57): er, no, no, it doesn't.
d275159e7b2073ebc4013dd29b1bd8f2 (16:58): carneous-,  which type of filesystem for a dual-system would be better?
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (16:59): if you want to share between linux and netbsd? probably ext2, I don't think linux support for ffs is any good.
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (16:59): netbsd will probably just mount it as ext2
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (16:59): thus potentially harming your journal
ce2a02cdaaee6dde37224039af86f431 (17:00): I have never tried this though - just watched people talk about it here
ac949c0b8b3df8f2b99a1723d94d0c60 (17:04): your journal shouldn't really be used, if Linux unmounted cleanly
a7249565f480308e64f52a18cedf8978 (17:18): ooh, today is netbsd pr hackathon
a7249565f480308e64f52a18cedf8978 (17:18): or hackaton(sic) according to the topic
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (17:33): Why the system need the interrupts to attach a device?
e258055e62edcc1d51276f64f463059e (17:38): most of autoconfiguration is done before interrupts are enabled
f17df95f77e0187feb7fa14ec3ef246b (17:39): uhm.. but i need interrupts to activate a device
